name: Clark E. RISSMILLER, Jr., and Helen F. Rissmiller, Appellants, v. Thomas J. LLEWELYN and Susanne R. Llewelyn and John A. Turtzo, Real Estate Agent, Individually and doing business as John A. Turtzo, Realtors

judges: Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY and KAUFFMAN, JJ.
parties: Clark E. RISSMILLER, Jr., and Helen F. Rissmiller, Appellants, v. Thomas J. LLEWELYN and Susanne R. Llewelyn and John A. Turtzo, Real Estate Agent, Individually and doing business as John A. Turtzo, Realtors.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM:
The appeal is dismissed as being improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Mark S. Sigmon, Bethlehem, for appellant.
Lawrence B. Fox, Bethlehem, for John A. Turtzo.
Gregg E. Mayrosh, Bethlehem, for the Llewelyns.
casebody.head_matter:
425 A.2d 744
Clark E. RISSMILLER, Jr., and Helen F. Rissmiller, Appellants, v. Thomas J. LLEWELYN and Susanne R. Llewelyn and John A. Turtzo, Real Estate Agent, Individually and doing business as John A. Turtzo, Realtors.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Jan. 26, 1981.
Decided Feb. 27, 1981.
Mark S. Sigmon, Bethlehem, for appellant.
Lawrence B. Fox, Bethlehem, for John A. Turtzo.
Gregg E. Mayrosh, Bethlehem, for the Llewelyns.
Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY and KAUFFMAN, JJ.
